text: is there a way to change a featured post based on the post tags you click? Like HubSpots blog??

Hi Community,
Has anyone been able to do this or no how?
End goal: Uses are logging into a website hosted on Wordpress. When they submit a form there since they already logged in I don't want them to have to enter their email address again. I want to submission to be connected to a contact in HubSpot and sync to HubSpot. Any thoughts on this?

HubSpot ties form submissions to emails, so you would need to have a hidden field with the user's email address prefilled. As for how to print their email address to the page some user management plugins may have snippets or shortcodes you could use. Otherwise you'll want to check the WP codex.
Anybody?? Is there a way to change a featured post based on the post tag page? Like HubSpots blog?? Thank you

<@UGMGP7A72> most of the users on here are located in the western hemisphere. For us in the western hemisphere your original post was between 2 and 4 AM. Understandably most people are not on, that’s why there’s a slow response, it’s not people ignoring you.

Secondly not - certain what you are trying to achieve exactly.

It sounds like you just want to use blog_recent_topic_posts and display just 1 post. which yes. that’s completely possible and simple to do

<@U7SL518D6> Apologies. I have a client blog which displays a featured post above the post listings. The client wants this post to change once you click a post tag IE Marketing. The post then grabs the first post in the marketing topic and displays it as a featured post. Hope that makes sense…
The trouble I have is that I have multiple post topics and don’t want to limit the featured post to one topic

if you’re going to require the person writing the blogs to use a special topic “featured” you could loop through all of the blog recent topic posts, for “featured” (grab say 100 posts) and loop through each of the posts checking if the topic matches the current topic page’s topic. if it does, print the the featured post html, else don’t display anything for it.

Is there any documentation to show how to custom code out a seperate menu for mobile as the HubSpot one is not displaying dropdowns correct or is generally not a good fit - ideallyu i could use jquery librarry here for full screen hamburger menus
you simply do it. You put in 2 menu modules, or use JS to make it. or use the new menu function, or use the HS default mobile menu which is a simple dropdown
if you go the 2 moduler route you just show one on desktop one on mobile
yes but what is the new menu function i have seen this mentioned but cant find any docs
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#menu>

Thanks, see the problem I am having is that how we want to display drop downs, we would like to use a serperate menu away with out the HubSpot css so even creating two menus, one for different for mobile it still uses the HubSpot csss

the menu css comes from your own styles file(it’s not in an immutable required file). it’s in the boilerplate css. So you can either edit it there, or use a class to override the css to make it look how you want on mobile

Thanks maybe I am not understanding this correct, but there are a lot of classes to override there...ideally i would like to use something like bigSlide.js a lquery library to quickly add a mobile menu and style that, but it seems I must use and edit the HubSpot styles, out of the box the styling on mobile looks like this on HubSpot , at least for me
Im also working on site dev by someone else and the menu currently in place has a lot of styles attached to override
i am sure there is a wp api call for this
Thanks Dennis. Do you know of which API call this is?
Thanks Jon
quick search: <https://torquemag.io/2015/08/working-with-users-via-the-wordpress-rest-api/>
or from wp itself: <https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/reference/users/#retrieve-a-user>
Managed to get this working! Took 4 hours!
Congrats!

client’s seeing a massive spike in google analytics traffic (2,300 unique page views in one day) to their email unsubscribe page with query parameter `?via_redirect=true`
*anyone have any idea what could be up with that?* it seems highly unlikely that many people all unsubscribed at once from their emails.
HubSpot is also not reporting anywhere near that many unsubscribes.

 The client is wondering if maybe hackers might be attempting to manipulate the page
Do they have GA on their site?
yes that’s where the page views came from
check the hostname report and see where its coming fro that way
i know we have a client with a crazy spike in traffic and it was all coming from aws
one thing to do in GA is to have a fliter on the view for hostname and only include the valid hostnames

my thinking is hackers were trying to identify legitimate email addresses by spamming the form with email addresses.

Then they would theoretically be able to impersonate the client in emails to those addresses
it could just be bad bot traffic too
i would recommend doing a test view and using this guide: <https://carloseo.com/removing-google-analytics-spam/#a-create-a-valid-hostname-filter-to-stop-ghost-spam->
we were able to kill alot of bot traffic with this
Thanks we’ll give it a shot
Ok I finally got a mobile menu in place and looking Ok, is there an easy way to have a close button X when the menu is opened <https://www.moonoia.com/docbrain-ai-platform>
in your case I’d just flip the hamburger to an X
you could use css or js to make that happen,
yeah, you can rely on that .mobile-open class on the body to trigger the change
add a nice transition and :bam:

Does anyone know of a <http://indeed.com|indeed.com> API that works within HubSpot? I'd like to show live search results in some sort of feed on my HubSpot site, didn't know if anyone had any experience w. this
You would need to use a proxy server to use the Indeed API ..
if you didnt the publisher Key would be visible to all.
Do you use proxy servers a lot? I’m finding this type of thing to come up a lot when I get asked for outside of HubSpot Functionality.
Does anyone know how to import and XML feed that isn’t WordPress or Square Space? I keep getting formatting error.
It depends on the API. some are CORS compatible.
Like Google Maps
what are you importing to the blog?

Also good to keep in mind <@UGMGP7A72> - this slack is not an official support channel for HubSpot - it's a community-building and collaboration area.

Yes, community members and HubSpotters do jump in to help when possible - but there's no guarantee or timeline.

Official Dev Support channel for HubSpot is: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers> = Now has 4+ dedicated HubSpot developers monitoring, replying, with the average response <13 hours (which we're working hard to lower even more).

For non-super technical questions or urgent emergencies, you can also always call into the support line. (they just aren't developers, so their coding knowledge only goes so far). :slightly_smiling_face:
Blog posts from a different CMS
so ive doen this and it requires a lot of copy and paste
you have to convert it into a wordpress xml format
Good reminder for everyone in the slack :slightly_smiling_face: :point_up_2:
but it can be done in a couple hours with patience
I did a few find and replaces… I was hoping for a convert tool :stuck_out_tongue:
naw.
sorry
:thumbs:
i get it
:thumbsup:
:thumbsup_all:
Thanks <@U22PKFRU5> I hadn’t seen that forum before.
good place to search for answers to questions :slightly_smiling_face:
<@UG2BUBUP4> Check out the "HubXML Blog Importer" open source tool - it's CMS agnostic: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/open-source>
Already found a potential solution to what I just asked :stuck_out_tongue:
Lol you beat me too it…
WOOT WOOT

Hi everyone :wave: I'm a developer/designer looking for some help on getting _really_ custom with HubSpot forms. Which channel / form / anything should I head to to talk to other designer/developers like me?
/poll "Would it be helpful to have a #Bugs channel to have a centralized place to report bugs :beetle::x:" "Yes :+1:" "No :-1:" "I want bacon :bacon:"
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>
:point_up_2:
Chad beat me too it hahah
I need a job
mixed feelings - if it’s a minor bug and it’s posted in the slack it might vanish into oblivion before a HS dev addresses it

the advantage though is for significant issues. like something that is like “OMG SITE DOWN SITE DOWN!” or “so… design manager is not working today”

 the other problem is a lot of people probably couldn’t tell if something was a bug or just their own not knowing how something worked

This might be a dumb question, but on pageload of all our pages with the HubSpot tracking code, the console gives an error `I18n locale / timezone loading timed out` in project.js:12855. Doesn't seem to be affecting anything, but anyone know what this error is or how to fix?
So not sure why it’s doing that and don’t think there’s likely anything you can do to fix it but `I18n` is related to translation.
so it might be the part of the script that determines the user’s locale (language and location combo)
ZING.
yummmm.... sushi :sushi: (had a TON of sushi last night)
hmm, yeah it's strange. Get the error on multiple computers and different networks. Oh well.
could try support I think it’s on HS’s end
hello
Macs and Floors.... Sorry no windows.
